PSDR - AAAA BBBB CCCC - Goods (excluding Motor Vehicles) 3

result.summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Retail Installment Contracts - Motor Vehicles
 
MCR 1152

Covered States: 
AK, AZ, CA, CT, DC, DE, FL, GA, IA, IL, KY, LA, MA, MD, MI, MN, MO, MS, NC, NE, NH, NJ, NM, NV, NY, OK, OR, PA, TX, UT, VA, VT, WI	

General Requirement Statement: 

When offering a retail installment contract for motor vehicles, Wells Fargo must ensure that the contract is signed, written, and fully discloses material terms within specified time frames. The contract must also follow certain formatting and style requirements.
 
1.	Lending Products (loans, lines and leases) – Asset Based Loans
2.	Lending Products (loans, lines and leases) – Consumer Other Loans/Lines
3.	Lending Products (loans, lines, and leases) - Non-consumer Loans/Lines 
4.	Lending Products (loans, lines, and leases) - Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC
5.	Insurance Products
 
Generally Applicable Supporting Citations: 

Alaska Stat. § 45.25.610(a); Ariz. Rev. Stat. § 44-286(A); Ariz. Rev. Stat. § 44-287(A); Ariz. Rev. Stat. § 44-287(B), (C); Cal. Civ. Code § 2982.2(b); Md. Code Ann., Transp. § 15-311.1(d); D.C. Mun. Regs. Tit. 16 § 320.1; D.C. Mun. Regs. Tit. 16 § 321(1)-(3); D.C. Mun. Regs. Tit. 16 § 321(4); Del. Code Ann. tit. 5, § 2907(a); Del. Code Ann. tit. 5, § 2907(d); Del. Code Ann. tit. 5, § 2907(e); Fla. Stat. § 520.07(1)(d); Ga. Code Ann. § 10-1-32(d); 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 375/5; 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 375/6(a); Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. § 190.100(1)(a); Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. § 190.100(2); La. Admin. Code tit. 46:V, § 7711(A)-(C) and (E); Mich. Comp. Laws § 566.302; Minn. Stat. § 53C.08(1a); Minn. Stat. § 53C.08(2); Miss. Code Ann. § 63-19-31(1)(a)-(b); Miss. Code Ann. § 63-19-31(1)(d); Miss. Code Ann. § 63-19-31(2); N.H. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:7(II); N.H. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:3-b(III); N.H. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:7(VIII); N.H. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:7(I)(a); N.M. Stat. Ann. § 58-19-7(E); N.M. Stat. Ann. § 58-19-7(A)-(B); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law § 302(4); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law § 302(5); Or. Rev. Stat. § 83.520(1); Or. Rev. Stat. § 83.520(3); Or. Rev. Stat. § 83.565(2)(a)-(c),(e); 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 6222(1)-(9); 7 Tex. Admin. Code § 84.804; 7 Tex. Admin. Code § 84.806(a); Stat. § 218.0142(2)(a); Wis. Stat. § 218.0142(4)
 
State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:
 
(1) Retail Installment Contracts (Form, Text, Format, Content) 

(a)	When offering a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must deliver to the buyer a written statement clearly describing enumerated items, and this statement must be signed by the buyer. (NC) N.C. Gen. Stat. § 20-303(b)

(b)	When offering a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must issue a written contract that contains all agreements of the parties and is signed by both parties. Wells Fargo must provide a copy signed by the retail buyer at the time the retail buyer executes the contract. Wells Fargo must also provide a copy signed by both the buyer and the seller within seven days after delivery of the vehicle. (MN) Minn. Stat. § 53C.08(a)

(c)	When offering a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must provide the printed portion of the contract in at least 8-point type. (OR) Or. Rev. Stat. § 83.520(2) 

(d)	When Wells Fargo issues a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, it must be signed by the buyer and, in at least 8-point font, contain specifically enumerated disclosures and information. In at least 10-point bold font, Wells Fargo must include: a specific statement when liability coverage for bodily injury and property damage caused to others is not included, and directly above the signature line, a verbatim statutory notice on the buyer's rights. (VT) Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 9, § 2355(a)-(c), (e)-(f)(2), (m)

(e)	When Wells Fargo issues applications for credit and contracts to be used in the sale of a motor vehicle, the applications must meet certain enumerated requirements. (NV) Nev. Rev. Stat. § 97.299(1)-(2)

(f)	When offering to customers a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, which does not conform to model contract provisions (i.e., a non-standard contract), Wells Fargo must first submit the proposed non-standard contract to the Texas Office of Consumer Credit Commissioner for review and approval. Among other requirements, Wells Fargo must file one copy of the contract in an unlocked, text-searchable, PDF format with page size measuring 8.5 x 11 inches or 8.5 x 14 inches. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code § 84.802(c)(2)

(g)	When providing a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must ensure that the font is at least 8-point size; the contract is signed by both Wells Fargo and the consumer; the contract contains all essential provisions prior to the buyer signing the contract; and the contract conspicuously states if no liability insurance coverage for bodily injury and property damage is included, and the notice statutorily given. (MA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 255B, § 9(1)

(h)	When Wells Fargo is acting as a seller in a motor vehicle sale, Wells Fargo must deliver to the buyer, or mail to the buyer at the buyer's address shown on the contract, a copy of the contract signed by Wells Fargo, otherwise, a buyer who has not received delivery of the motor vehicle has the right to rescind the agreement, receive a refund of all payments made, and return all goods or receive equivalent value. If Wells Fargo is acting as the buyer in a motor vehicle sale, it must acknowledge receipt of the delivery of a copy of the contract in at least 10-point bold type and, if contained in the contract, this acknowledgement must appear directly above the buyer's signature. (DE) Del. Code Ann. tit. 5, § 2907(c) 

(i)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must include a notice with verbatim statutory language advising the buyer not to sign the contract if there are missing terms, and that the buyer is entitled to a copy of the signed contract, among other things. (MA, MI, PA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 255B, § 9(1); Mich. Comp. Laws § 492.112(d); 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 6223(b)

(j)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must include a notice with verbatim statutory language in at least 10-point boldface type regarding the debtor's rights to assert claims and defenses against the holder of the contract. (MI) Mich. Comp. Laws § 492.114a(c) and (d)

(k)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must include a notice with certain statutory language in at least 6-point type. (FL) Fla. Stat. § 520.07(b)

(l)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must include a notice with certain statutory language in at least 10-point type, while the remainder of the printed portion of the contract must be at least 8-point type.  (NH) N.H. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:7(I)(b)

(m)	When offering a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must issue a contract that contains the names of the seller and the buyer, if an indirect loan, or the names of the sales finance company and the buyer, if a direct loan, the place of business of the seller, if an indirect loan, or the sales finance company, if a direct loan, the legal residence or place of business of the buyer as specified by the buyer and, for an indirect loan, a description of the motor vehicle including its make, year, model and identification numbers or marks. When acting as the sales finance company for a direct loan, Wells Fargo must retain in the loan file a copy of the purchase and sale agreement between the buyer and the seller that contains a description of the motor vehicle that is substantially similar to the description required in the contract for an indirect loan. (NH) N.H. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:7(I)(d)

(n)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must ensure that the contract contains specific information regarding the buyer, seller, and vehicle, as well as specific price terms, including aggregate amounts paid for insurance and other fees. (MO) Mo. Rev. Stat. § 365.070(5); Mo. Rev. Stat. § 365.070(6)

(o)	In a retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must ensure that the contract has an addendum where the extender of credit agrees to waive the consumer's debt for the difference between the amount paid by the consumer's primary insurance and the net payoff of the contract, accompanied by a clear statement in the waiver form that is given to the consumer that the consumer's debt is waived. The consumer must also have the right to cancel the debt waiver or debt forgiveness agreement and be entitled to a refund of the premium paid no less favorable to the consumer than the rule of 78's or pro-rata, and there cannot be a deductible provision in the agreement. (LA) La. Admin. Code tit. 46:V, § 7711(A)-(C) and (E)

(p)	Prior to the buyer's execution of an installment sale contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must provide to the buyer an oral and written disclosure in plain language that contains the statutorily required elements. (PA) 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 6221(e)

(q)	When offering a non-model standard retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must include a certification of readability, which must state, among other things, that the contract is printed in an easily readable font and type size. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code § 84.802(a) and (b)	

(r)	To be easily readable, Wells Fargo must use Arial, Calibri, Caslon, Century Schoolbook, Garamond, Helvetica, Scala, or Times New Roman typeface in at least 8-point font for its motor vehicle installment contracts.  Texas has the most restrictive font type requirements. (IL, TX) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 375/3(b)-(c); 7 Tex. Admin. Code § 84.806(b); 7 Tex. Admin. Code § 84.806(d)

(s)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must state certain liability disclosure language, and a verbatim "Notice to Buyer." IL and NY have the most restrictive requirements as Wells Fargo must also state "RETAIL INSTALLMENT CONTRACT" in at least 10-point bold font both at the top of the contract and above the signature line. (DE, FL, GA, IL, NM, NY) Del. Code Ann. tit. 5, § 2907(b); Fla. Stat. § 520.07(1)(b); Ga. Code Ann. § 10-1-32(b); 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 375/3(b)-(c); N.M. Stat. Ann. § 58-19-7(D); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law § 302(2)(a)-(c); Or. Rev. Stat. § 83.520(2)

(t)	When Wells Fargo issues a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase that provides for a finance charge computed by the actuarial method, Wells Fargo must provide the unique statutorily required notice in print of at least 10-point boldface type, instead of the notice ordinarily required by Or. Rev. Stat. § 83.520(2). (OR) Or. Rev. Stat. § 83.565(d)	

(u)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must include a specific disclosure notice to the buyer in 10-point font that is either bold, capitalized, or underlined directly above the buyer's signature. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.102(c)

(v)	When Wells Fargo issues a contract with a finance charge determined by the unearned portion of the finance charge to be refunded upon full prepayment, the contract must contain several enumerated notices, all of which must be at least 10-point boldface font if the contract is printed. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code § 2982(g)(1)

(w)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must print the text (except for instructions) in at least 8-point type; the statutorily required "Notice to Buyer" in at least 10-point type; and the acknowledgment by the buyer of delivery of a copy of the contract in at least 10-point type, which must also be located above the buyer's signature. (MO) Mo. Rev. Stat. § 365.070(2), Mo. Rev. Stat. § 365.070(3), Mo. Rev. Stat. § 365.070(4) 

(x)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must include specific information and verbatim statutory language relating to dealer processing charges and freight charges in 12-point type or larger. Wells Fargo must print the Disclosure Form on an easily distinguishable, separate sheet of paper, in at least 12-point font, and provide a copy to the buyer(s). (VT) 21-010-017 Vt. Code R. § 6

(y)	With respect to font size on disclosure statements in connection with a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Connecticut has the most restrictive standard. Wells Fargo must print the headings of the enumerated disclosure statement no smaller than 18-point font, while the text of the disclosure must be a minimum of 12-point font. (CT) Conn. Agencies Regs. § 42-179-8(a), (b) 

(z)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must meet its itemized disclosure requirement by either putting the disclosure requirement on a separate page or by placing the disclosure on the same document as the contract so long as it is clearly and conspicuously segregated. (FL) Fla. Admin. Code Ann. R. 69V-50.085.

(aa)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must include the amount financed, the finance charge, total of payments, total sale price and payment details. (FL) Fla. Stat. § 520.07(2)(a)-(e)

(bb)	When Wells Fargo is acting as a seller in a motor vehicle sale, it must provide a separate written itemization of the amount financed and disclose the cash price; the amount of down payment; the difference between the cash price and the down payment; the amounts, if any, included for insurance and other benefits, specifying the types of coverages and benefits; and any taxes and official fees not included in the cash price. (FL) Fla. Stat. § 520.07(3)

(cc)	When Wells Fargo is the holder of a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase and the buyer provides a written request, Wells Fargo must give or forward to the buyer a written statement of the dates and amounts of payments and the total amount unpaid under such contract. Wells Fargo must provide the buyer a written receipt for any payment made in cash. (FL) Fla. Stat. § 520.07(8)(a)

(2) Retail Installment Contract Terms

(a)	Payment Terms
(i)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must provide for payment of the time balance in substantially equal times and amounts, except in certain enumerated circumstances. (PA) 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 6221(d) 

(ii)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must not include an acceleration clause. (PA) 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 6228(2)

(iii)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must give or forward to the retail buyer a written statement of the total amount unpaid under the retail installment contract upon written request from the retail buyer and give the retail buyer a written receipt for any payment when made in cash. (MS) Miss. Code Ann. § 63-19-39

(iv)	As a creditor in a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must provide a notice containing contact information for Wells Fargo in certain verbatim statutory language and must disclose certain information regarding its method(s) used for computing interest. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code § 84.805(a)-(b)

(v)	When Wells Fargo is acting as the holder of the retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, they must provide to the buyer a statement of dates and amounts of installment payments and the total amount unpaid under the contract, when the buyer so requests in writing.  Wells Fargo must also provide the buyer a written receipt for any cash payments. (VT) Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 9, § 2355(k)

(vi)	When Wells Fargo is acting as a seller in a motor vehicle sale, Wells Fargo must ensure that the Cash Price is consistent on all forms. When manufacturer rebates are disclosed on the motor vehicle installment contract, but not used to reduce the Cash Price, Wells Fargo must deduct them from the Cash Price on the Disclosure Form. (VT) 21-010-017 Vt. Code R. § 4(3)

(vii)	When the calculation of the Cash Price for a motor vehicle sale includes Optional Items, Wells Fargo must itemize them on the retail installment contract in a conspicuous manner and deduct them from the Cash Price to reach the Vehicle Price. (VT) 21-010-017 Vt. Code R. § 5(1); 21-010-017 Vt. Code R. § 8

(b)	Fees and Charges 
(i)	Wells Fargo must compute the finance charges and balance on a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase based on certain enumerated factors and disclosures. (CA, FL, KY, LA, MI, NH) Cal. Civ. Code § 2982(g)(2); Cal. Civ. Code § 2982 (g)(3); Fla. Stat. § 520.08(1)-(3); La. Admin. Code tit. 46:V, § 7711(D); Mich. Comp. Laws § 492.118(1)-(5); NH. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:8(I)-(III)

(ii)	When Wells Fargo seeks to include a documentary fee in a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, it must provide a verbatim statutory notice next to where the documentary fee is disclosed. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.006(c)(3) 

(iii)	Wells Fargo must have the buyer agree in writing before Wells Fargo increases the amount of a contract balance or the amount of any installment. (CA) Cal. Civ. Code § 2984 

(iv)	When Wells Fargo issues a retail installment sales agreement, the agreement must contain a statement of how the unpaid net balance is determined. (LA) La. Admin. Code tit. 46:V, § 7711(D)

(v)	Wells Fargo must not include in its retail installment contracts a credit service charge that exceeds the maximum loan finance charge rate that could be charged, contracted for, or received in a consumer loan where the amount deferred is the same as the amount financed and the term is a corresponding term. (LA) La. Stat. Ann. § 6:969.11(A) and (B)(1)

(vi)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must not include a credit service charge or delinquency charge that violates statutorily enumerated calculations. (LA, DE, GA, KY, NY) La. Stat. Ann § 6.969.11(A) and (B)(1); Del. Code Ann. tit. 5, § 2907(h); Ga. Code Ann. § 10-1-32(g); Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. § 190.100(1)(d)

(vii)	Wells Fargo must compute its credit service charge by evaluating the difference between the cash sale price or the motor vehicle and the amount of the buyer's down payment and the amount of official fees, and such charge may be made on the amount included in the contract for insurance as determined under NY law. (NY) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law § 303(1) and (2)

(viii)	On any contract for a motor vehicle purchase with a variable rate credit service charge, Wells Fargo must determine the rate by following enumerated instructions. (NY) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law § 303(4)

(ix)	When Wells Fargo prohibits a buyer under a retail installment contract for the sale of a motor vehicle from transferring the buyer's equity to another person without Wells Fargo's consent, Wells Fargo must not charge a transfer fee greater than 10% of the remaining unpaid balance or $25, whichever is less. (DC) D.C. Mun. Regs. Tit. 16 § 331(1) and (2) 

(x)	Wells Fargo must not permit any loan processing fee on a motor vehicle retail installment contract to exceed $200 and must meet other statutory requirements. (FL) Fla. Admin. Code Ann. R. 69V-50.075

(c)	Blank Spaces; Missing or Incomplete Terms  
(i)	When offering a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase to a buyer, Wells Fargo must not provide (or accept) a contract that contains blank spaces to be filled in after the contract has been signed, except with respect to certain terms and under certain circumstances. (DE, GA, MA, MO, NH, OR, PA, TX) Del. Code Ann. tit. 5, § 2907(i); Ga. Code Ann. § 10-1-32(b); Ga. Code Ann. § 10-1-32(h); Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 255B, § 12; Mo. Rev. Stat. § 365.110; N.H. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:3-b(V); N.H. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:7(VI); Or. Rev. Stat. § 83.530(2)(a),(b); 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 6228(1); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.112(b)

(d)	Waiver of Rights; Confessions of Judgment
(i)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must not include a provision waiving a retailer buyer's rights of action for an illegal act committed in collection of payments or repossession of the motor vehicle. (NH, TX, PA) N.H. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:7(VIII)(5); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.412(a) and (b); 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 6228(4)

(ii)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must not waive any of the buyer's protections provided under Pennsylvania statutes, including indirect waiver through choice of law provisions. (PA) 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 6234(a), (b)

(iii)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must not include any provision requiring a consumer to authorize power of attorney. (KY, MN, NH, OR, PA, TX); Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. § 190.100(1)(c); Minn. Stat. § 53C.08(1)(b); N.H. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:7(VIII)(1); Or. Rev. Stat. § 83.670(4); 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 6228(5); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.410
(A)	In more restrictive states, Wells Fargo also must not include a confession of judgement provision. (KY, MN, NH, TX) Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. § 190.100(1)(c); Minn. Stat. § 53C.08(1)(b); N.H. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:7(VIII)(1); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.410

(iv)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must not include any provision assigning the wages of the consumer. (KY, NH, TX) Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. § 190.100(1)(c); N.H. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:7(VIII)(1); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.410

(v)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must not include a provision waiving the retail buyer's right to assert a claim or defense against Wells Fargo relating to the collection of payments under the contract, the repossession of the motor vehicle, or other claims or defenses arising out of the sale. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.412(a), (b) 

(vi)	When acting as a retail buyer, any act or agreement of Wells Fargo before or at the time of the making of a retail installment contract or a purchase under the contract must not and will not waive any provision of this chapter. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.412(a), (b) 

(vii)	When Wells Fargo enters into a lease for a motor vehicle, Wells Fargo must not include any provision waiving a consumer's right to make statements regarding the manufacturer, seller, lessor, or goods or services provided under the contract. (NJ) N.J. Stat. Ann § 56:12-16.1(a); N.J. Stat. Ann. § 56:12-49.1

(viii)	Wells Fargo must not provide in a retail installment sale contract any provision requiring the execution of a note or notes by the buyer which, when separately negotiated, will extinguish the buyer's rights of action or defenses as to third parties that the buyer might otherwise have had against the original seller. (PA) 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 6228(7) 

(ix)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must not include a provision that relieves Wells Fargo from liability for legal remedies that the buyer may have had against Wells Fargo under the contract or under a separate agreement connected to the contract. (AZ, DE, PA) Ariz. Rev. Stat. § 44-290(B); Del. Code Ann. tit. 5, § 2907(k); 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 6228(6)

(x)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must not include a provision that allows the seller or holder of a contract to enter upon the buyer's premises unlawfully or to commit any breach of the peace in repossession of the motor vehicle. (NY, OR) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law § 302(13)(c); Or. Rev. Stat. § 83.670(2)

(xi)	In a retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must not put in any provision that permits the holder to waive the buyer's right to notice of default or under which a buyer waives any right, benefit, or privilege which is conferred upon the buyer. (NH) N.H. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:7(IX)(a), (d)

(e)	Choice of Law and Forum Selection Clauses
(i)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must not include a choice of law or forum selection provision choosing a law or forum outside of Louisiana. (LA) La. Stat. Ann § 6:969.42(A); La. Stat. Ann § 6.969.42(B)

(f)	Attorneys' Fees Provisions
(i)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must not include a provision that provides for the payment of attorneys' fees that do not meet certain criteria. (DE) Del. Code Ann. tit. 5, § 2907(h) 

(3) Buyer's Acknowledgement of Delivery

(a)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must obtain a written acknowledgment from the buyer regarding the delivery and receipt of contract to the buyer. Wells Fargo must print the written acknowledgement in at least 10-point boldface type, and if contained in the contract, must be printed directly above the buyer's signature or adjacent to any other notices required by law to be placed immediately above the buyer's signature. (CA, NM, TX) Cal. Civ. Code § 2984.3; N.M. Stat. Ann. § 58-19-7(C); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.112(a); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.112(b)

(b)	In a retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must deliver a signed copy of the contract to the buyer. Prior to providing a copy of the contract and before delivery of the motor vehicle, Wells Fargo must allow the consumer the right to rescind the agreement and receive a full refund of payments made and/or return of goods traded for the contract. Wells Fargo must obtain a written acknowledgment from the buyer regarding the delivery of a copy of the contract, and the written acknowledgment must be printed in at least 10-point bold type and if attached to the contract, printed directly above the buyer's signature. In addition, Wells Fargo must ensure that the retail installment contract contains certain information including contact information of the parties and description of the vehicle. For a direct loan, Wells Fargo must retain in the loan file a copy of the purchase and sale agreement that contains a description of the vehicle. (NH) N.H. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:7(I)(c)

(c)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, before the transaction is consummated, Wells Fargo must deliver to the buyer a copy of the contract or a separate statement with disclosures required by the law. Prior to providing a copy of the contract and before delivery of the motor vehicle, Wells Fargo must allow the consumer the right to rescind the agreement and receive a full refund of payments made and/or return of goods traded for the contract. Wells Fargo must obtain a written acknowledgment from the buyer regarding the delivery of a copy of the contract, and if attached to the contract, must be printed directly above the buyer's signature. Wells Fargo must not sign or require a buyer to sign a retail installation contract where it contains blank spaces to be filled after it has been signed, except with respect to certain terms and under certain circumstances. (FL) Fla. Stat. § 520.07(1)(c) and (e)(7)

(d)	In retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must obtain a written acknowledgment from the buyer regarding the delivery and receipt of contract to the buyer. Wells Fargo must print the written acknowledgement in at least 12-point size font and, if attached to the contract, it must be printed below the buyer's signature to the contract and separately signed. (MI) Mich. Comp. Laws § 492.112(e)
(4) Assignment of Retail Installment Contracts 

(a)	When assigning or being assigned a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must notify the buyer of the assignment and follow other statutorily enumerated procedures, otherwise payment by the retail buyer to the last known holder of the contract shall be binding on all subsequent holders or assignees of the contract. (FL, KY, MN, MO, MS, NH, NM, TX) Fla. Stat. § 520.08(4); Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. § 190.100(1)(e); Minn. Stat. § 53C.08(1)(d); Mo. Rev. Stat. § 365.130(1); Miss. Code Ann. § 63-19-45; N.H. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:8(IV); N.M. Stat. Ann. § 58-19-14; Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.303

(b)	When Wells Fargo acquires a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase from a retail seller, Wells Fargo must mail or deliver to the buyer a written notice of the acquisition within 30 days. (WI) Wis. Stat. § 218.0142(6)(a)

(5) Amendments of Retail Installment Contracts; Refinancing

(a)	When Wells Fargo seeks to amend or correct a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, it must confirm so in writing signed by the retail buyer, and then deliver or mail a copy of that confirmation to the buyer. (CA, TX) Cal Civ. Code § 2984; Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.116(1), (2)

(b)	When Wells Fargo agrees to amend a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase at the buyer's request to extend or defer any or all installments, Wells Fargo must not charge a refinance fee or other fees that exceed certain statutory limitations. (KY, MO) Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. § 190.100(1)(f); Mo. Rev. Stat. § 365.130(2); Mo. Rev. Stat. § 365.130(3)

(c)	 Wells Fargo must give or forward to the retail buyer for a motor vehicle, upon the buyer's request, a written statement of the total amount unpaid under the retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase upon written request from the retail buyer and give the retail buyer a written receipt for any payment when made in cash. (KS, MS) Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. § 190.100(1)(f); Miss. Code Ann. § 63-19-39

(d)	In a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must disclose that any refinancing may be for any period and payment schedule to which the buyer and Wells Fargo agree. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.123(c) and (b)(5)

(6) Advertising; Misleading or False Statements  

(a)	Wells Fargo, acting as a licensee, must not make any false or misleading advertisements regarding any part of a motor vehicle retail installment sales contract. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code § 84.702(a)

(b)	When transferring ownership of a motor vehicle, Wells Fargo must disclose the vehicle's mileage in writing to the transferee. Wells Fargo must not knowingly make false statements regarding the mileage or odometer reading or alter in any way any information provided in the mileage disclosure statement. (WI) Wis. Stat. § 342.155(1)(a); Wis. Stat. § 342.155(2); Wis. Stat. § 342.155(3)

(c)	When Wells Fargo, acting as a licensee, advertises rates, terms, or conditions of a motor vehicle installment transaction, it must comply with federal disclosure requirements. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code § 84.702(d)

(7) Buyer's Revocation of Motor Vehicle in Retail Installment Contract; Bond Requirement

(a)	When Wells Fargo is acting as a buyer in a motor vehicle purchase, and the retail installment contract provides that if a buyer rejects or revokes acceptance of the motor vehicle and asserts a security interest in the motor vehicle based on the ground of rightful rejection or justifiable revocation, Wells Fargo must post a bond of the disputed balance or deposit all accrued installment payments into a court registry. (FL) Fla. Stat. § 520.07(10)(a)-(b)	
 
(8) Prepayments on Retail Installment Contracts; Refunds 

(a)	When Wells Fargo receives prepayment from a buyer of any portion of a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must refund certain unearned charges, and those unearned charges must be computed in a manner that is at least as favorable to the buyer as the actuarial method. (MA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 255B, § 10
 
(9) Final Installment Payments; Notices 

(a)	In a motor vehicle purchase contract, fourteen days before a final installment is due as originally scheduled or deferred, Wells Fargo must give the buyer notice of the interest charge on any balance remaining unpaid at the annual percentage rate stated in the motor vehicle contract until fully paid or reduced to judgment. (IL) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 375/11.2

(b)	When Wells Fargo enters into a balloon contract with a motor vehicle purchase, it must contain certain enumerated provisions. (NH) NH. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:8-a(III)(a); NH. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:8-a(III)(c) and (d); NH. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:8-a(V); NH. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:8-a(VII)


(10) Sales of Repossessed Vehicles; Disclosures

(a)	When offering a motor vehicle for sale, Wells Fargo must ensure that the contract is in writing upon a form that may be adopted and promulgated by the state board and approved by the Attorney General. Wells Fargo must ensure that the contract contains all the agreements between the parties and is signed by the buyer and seller. (NE) Neb. Rev. Stat. § 60-1417

(b)	Prior to or concurrent with selling a motor vehicle, Wells Fargo must deliver to the buyer written documentation disclosing certain enumerated information. (NE) Neb. Rev. Stat. § 60-1417

(c)	When operating as a manufacturer or dealer, Wells Fargo must provide prior written disclosure in a clear and conspicuous manner in order to offer, auction, sell, lease, transfer, or exchange a motor vehicle that is known to be a buyback vehicle or a nonconforming vehicle. (UT) Utah Code Ann. § 41-3-408(1)

(d)	When issuing a contract for sale or lease for a buyback or nonconforming vehicle, Wells Fargo must, in 12-point font and boxed, provide a specifically enumerated disclosure statement, and the header must be in 16-point font, extra bold.  Wells Fargo must also list each nonconformity on a numbered line; and obtain the consumer's acknowledgement via signature of the disclosures prior to completing the sale, lease, or transfer.  Once the transaction is complete, Wells Fargo must, within 30 days, deliver the disclosure to the Motor Vehicle Division. (UT) Utah Code Ann. § 41-3-408(2)

(e)	When issuing a contract for sale or lease for a buyback or nonconforming vehicle, Wells Fargo must obtain the consumer's acknowledgement via signature of the disclosures prior to completing the sale, lease, or transfer. (UT) Utah Code Ann. § 41-3-408(2)(e)

(f)	After completing the transaction of a buyback or nonconforming vehicle, Wells Fargo must deliver a copy of the signed disclosure to the Motor Vehicle Division within 30 days. (UT) Utah Code Ann. § 41-3-408(2)(f)

(g)	On a nonconforming vehicle, Wells Fargo must affix a specifically enumerated disclosure statement in conformance with the statute on the lower corner of the windshield furthest from the driver's side.  The disclosure statement must be at least 4-1/2 inches wide and 5 inches long, with the heading in boldface, capital letters not smaller than 18-point font, and the body copy must be regular or medium face type not smaller than 12-point font. (UT) Utah Code Ann. § 41-3-408(3)
 
(h)	Prior to completing the transaction of a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must deliver the Disclosure Form, even if the transaction involves negative equity.  When Wells Fargo assigns, sells, or transfers the motor vehicle installment contract, the Disclosure Form must be attached. When Wells Fargo is acting as a motor vehicle dealer, it must provide the buyer with an unexecuted copy of the Disclosure Form, and it must be signed by the buyer prior to completing the transaction.  (VT) 21-010-017 Vt. Code R. § 7(1)-(3)

(i)	On the Disclosure Form for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must disclose the amount financed as a percentage of the Vehicle Price to determine whether negative equity is being financed in the transaction. (VT) 21-010-017 Vt. Code R. § 5(2)

(j)	Wells Fargo must deliver the Disclosure Form with every motor vehicle installment contract, even if it involves negative equity. (DE) 5-2900-2901 Del. Admin. Code § 5.0

(k)	In a negative equity trade-in transaction where no cash payment is involved, Wells Fargo must disclose a zero down-payment. Wells Fargo must not indicate the negative equity as a negative number for the consumer's down payment. (DE) 5-2900-2901 Del. Admin. Code § 5.0 

(l)	For a motor vehicle purchase contract, when Wells Fargo receives a request from a buyer for cash receipts or information on current balances or amounts due, Wells Fargo must provide the buyer with such receipts or information in writing. (GA) Ga. Code Ann. § 10-1-32(i)

(m)	When Wells Fargo receives a written request from a buyer in a retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must provide the buyer with a written statement with dates, amounts of payments, and total amount unpaid under the contract. Wells Fargo must provide the retail buyer with one statement during a six-month period without charge. Wells Fargo must not charge more than $1 for each additional requested statement. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.405(a), (b)

(11) Conditional Sale Contracts

(a)	When Wells Fargo issues a conditional sale contract for a motor vehicle purchase, it must contain certain notices and meet certain formatting requirements. (CA) Cal Civ. Code § 2982(r); Cal Civ. Code § 2982(h); Cal Civ. Code § 2982.2; Cal Civ. Code § 2984.1 

(b)	When offering a conditional sale contract for a motor vehicle purchase, Wells Fargo must not include certain enumerated provisions. (CA) Cal Civ. Code § 2984.2(a)-(c)

(12) Pre-Lease Agreements

(a)	When Wells Fargo is entering into a prelease agreement for a motor vehicle, it must place specific notice language directly above the signature line, in bold-faced capital letters in at least 10-point font, under the heading: NOTICE TO PROSPECTIVE LESSEE. (WI) Wis. Stat. § 218.0144(2)
 
(13) Lease or Buyback Agreements

(a)	When engaged in a contract for the lease or buyback of a motor vehicle, Wells Fargo must provide certain written disclosure language in the contract in 12-point boldface type and heading in 16-point boldface type. The language of the "DISCLOSURE STATEMENT" must be boxed and contain a notice warning that the vehicle was previously sold as new and disclosing any defects or conditions subsequently alleged or found. (CT) Conn. Agencies Regs. § 42-179-8(c), (d)
 
(14) Debt Cancellation Agreements

(a)	When Wells Fargo is acting as a retail seller in a motor vehicle purchase, it must provide the buyer notice in connection with the retail installment contract stating that the retail buyer is not required to accept or provide a debt cancellation agreement to purchase the motor vehicle under a retail installment contract. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.124(d)

(b)	When Wells Fargo seeks to include money advanced or debt cancellation agreements in the retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, it must be included as an itemized charge. (KY, TX) Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. § 190.100(7)(b); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.404(d)	

(c)	When Wells Fargo is acting as retail seller of a debt cancellation agreement for total loss or theft of an ordinary vehicle, Wells Fargo must provide the buyer a copy of the agreement within 10 days of the date of the agreement, and the agreement must set forth specific details. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code § 84.308(d)

(15) Motor Vehicle Title Loans 

(a)	When Wells Fargo is a licensee for a motor vehicle title loan, it must provide each borrower with a pamphlet that is in a form consistent with regulations and plainly explains the borrowers' rights and responsibilities and provides a toll-free number for the Commission for assistance with complaints. (VA) Va. Code Ann. § 6.2-2215(5)

(16) Disclaimers of Liability

(a)	When Wells Fargo wants to ensure that the buyer in a motor vehicle purchase contract will be responsible upon total loss of the vehicle, Wells Fargo must notify the buyer and require the buyer to sign a separate document that conspicuously discloses that responsibility. (NY) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law § 302A(1)

(b)	When party to a motor vehicle purchase contract and statutorily required to offer to waive its contractual right to hold the buyer liable for the gap amount in the event of a total loss of the vehicle, Wells Fargo must also fulfill certain enumerated requirements in the notice. (NY) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law § 302A(1)
 
(17) Automobile Club Memberships

(a)	When Wells Fargo offers to sell an automobile club membership to a retail buyer, the contract must contain certain enumerated notices to the buyer. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.412(a), (b)

(b)	When Wells Fargo is acting as a retail seller and offers an automobile club membership as part of a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase, the bank must notify the retail buyer if the membership includes services provided by the manufacturer as part of the motor vehicle purchase. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.414(a)

(18) Disclosures Regarding Electronic Tracking Technology 

(a)	When entering a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle as a creditor or a long-term lessor, Wells Fargo must notify the buyer prior to receiving signature, a written notification separate from the contract or lease that can be retained by the buyer that the motor vehicle is equipped with electronic tracking technology that may be used by Wells Fargo to verify the operational status of the technology, to service the contract or lease, or to locate the vehicle for repossession. (NV) Nev. Rev. Stat. § 598.9715(1), (3)

(b)	When entering into a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase as a creditor or a long-term lessor in which the vehicle will be equipped with starter interruption technology, Wells Fargo must, before the buyer signs the contract or lease, enter into a separate written agreement with the buyer that meets the statutory requirements and acknowledges the starter interruption technology. (NV) Nev. Rev. Stat. § 598.9715(2)
 
(19) Insurance Products
 
(a)	When offering a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase that includes insurance, Wells Fargo must include certain statutory disclosures pertaining to the type of insurance and scope of coverage, and the insurance must comply with applicable Texas state laws. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.209(a); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.209(b)-(d)

(b)	When offering a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase with the option to purchase life insurance, accident and health insurance, or involuntary unemployment insurance, Wells Fargo must include certain disclosure language in 10-point boldface type informing the buyer that the buyer is not required to purchase credit insurance to obtain credit, and to receive insurance, the buyer must sign and agree to pay an additional charge. (MA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 255B, § 10

(c)	When offering a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase that includes credit life insurance or credit disability insurance, the installment contract must include a disclosure notice containing information regarding the buyer's entitlement to partial refund of any premiums from prepayment of the installment loan. (IL) 815 Ill Comp. Stat. 375/9.02(1) and (2)

(d)	When offering a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase that provides for insurance coverage, Wells Fargo must either ensure that the policy includes public liability coverage protecting the driver against damages from negligent use of the vehicle or notify to the buyer in writing at the time of the contract that the motor vehicle is not covered by public liability insurance and obtaining a signed acknowledgment from the buyer indicating that he or she has been so notified. (WI) Wis. Stat. § 218.0143(1)-(2)

(e)	When engaging in a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase that includes insurance coverage for the buyer, Wells Fargo must provide copies of any policies, certificates of insurance, and other coverage information to the buyer within 30 days of the execution of the retail installment contract, as well as comply with other statutory requirements. (CT, IL, KY, NY, MN, MO, PA) Conn. Agencies Regs. § 38a-288-2; 815 Ill Comp. Stat. 375/9; Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. § 190.100(4); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law § 302(6); Minn. Stat. § 53C.08(3); Mo. Rev. Stat. § 365.080(1); 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 6241(c)(2), (3), (5) and (7)

(f)	When Wells Fargo purchases insurance for the benefit of the buyer, the retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase must state the amount of insurance.  Wells Fargo must also provide a certificate of insurance to the buyer within 30 days of the execution of the retail installment contract.  (VT) Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 9, § 2355(g)

(g)	When Wells Fargo offers a retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase that includes insurance coverage, Wells Fargo must ensure that the policies or certificates of insurance are written for the full term for which a premium has been charged to the borrower, and Wells Fargo must pay all such premiums to the insurance company for whom the premium was collected. (CT) Conn. Agencies Regs. § 38a-288-4

(h)	When the retail installment contract for a motor vehicle purchase charges for insurance, but Wells Fargo is unable to purchase the insurance or the insurance premium cost changes, Wells Fargo must advise the purchaser in writing by certified or registered mail within 5 calendar days of learning of the inability or increase. (DC) D.C. Mun. Regs. Tit. 16 § 326(1)
result.name: TEST 4.12 C

result.summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Retail Installment Contracts - Motor Vehicles

MCR 1152

Covered States: 
AK, AZ, CA, CT, DC, DE, FL, GA, IA, IL, KY, LA, MA, MD, MI, MN, MO, MS, NC, NE, NH, NJ, NM, NV, NY, OK, OR, PA, TX, UT, VA, VT, WI	
		
General Requirement Statement: 
When offering a retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must ensure that the contract is signed, written, and fully discloses material terms. In addition, the contract must follow certain formatting and style requirements. Wells Fargo must also provide certain notices, disclosures and itemized information in a separate document, in easily legible and plain language. These notices and disclosures must be delivered to the buyer or lessor within certain designated times. Wells Fargo must also provide a schedule of payments.

State-Specific Restrictive Requirements:

1.	Lending Products (loans, lines and leases) – Asset Based Loans, Lending Products (loans, lines and leases) – Consumer Other Loans/Lines, Lending Products (loans, lines, and leases) - Non-consumer Loans/Lines & Lending Products (loans, lines, and leases) - Other Commercial/Wholesale Loans & LOC 

a.	 In a retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must not include:
 
i.	a power of attorney, confession of judgment, or an assignment of wages. (MN, NH, KY, TX, PA, OR) Minn. Stat. § 53C.08(1)(b); N.H. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:7(VIII)(1); Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. § 190.100(1)(c); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.410; 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 6228(5); Or. Rev. Stat. § 83.670(4)
 
ii.	a waiver of the retailer buyers' rights of action for an illegal act committed in collection of payments or repossession of the motor vehicle. (TX, PA) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.412(a) and (b); 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 6228(4)
 
iii.	a provision waiving the retail buyer's right to assert a claim or defense against Wells Fargo or third parties arising out the sale or contract or to post a statement on the internet regarding the seller or manufacturer of the vehicle. (TX, NJ, PA) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.412(a) and (b); N.J. Stat. Ann § 56:12-16.1(a); N.J. Stat. Ann. § 56:12-49.1; 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 6228(7)
 
iv.	a choice of law or forum selection provision choosing a law or forum outside of Louisiana. (LA) La. Stat. Ann § 6:969.42(A); La. Stat. Ann § 6.969.42(B)
 
v.	a provision that relieves Wells Fargo from liability. (AZ, PA, DE) Ariz. Rev. Stat. § 44-290(B); Del. Code Ann. tit. 5, § 2907(k); 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 6228(6)
 
vi.	a provision that provides for the payment of attorneys' fees that do not meet certain criteria. (DE, NY) Del. Code Ann. tit. 5, § 2907(h); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law § 302(7)
 
vii.	an acceleration clause. (PA) 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 6228(2)
 
viii.	a provision that allows the seller or holder of a contract to enter upon the buyer's premises unlawfully. (NY, OR) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law § 302(13)(c); Or. Rev. Stat. § 83.670(2)
 
ix.	blank spaces. (DE, GA, NH, PA, TX) Del. Code Ann. tit. 5, § 2907(i); Ga. Code Ann. § 10-1-32(b); Ga. Code Ann. § 10-1-32(h); N.H. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:3-b(V); 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 6228(1); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.112(b)
 
x.	a credit service charge or delinquency charge that violates statutorily enumerated calculations. (LA, NY, DE, GA, KY, NY) La. Stat. Ann § 6.969.11(A) and (B)(1); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law § 303(4), N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law § 303(1) and (2); Del. Code Ann. tit. 5, § 2907(h); Ga. Code Ann. § 10-1-32(g); Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. § 190.100(1)(d); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law § 302(7)
 
b.	When assigning or being assigned a retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must notify the buyer of the assignment and follow other statutorily enumerated procedures, otherwise payment by the retail buyer to the last known holder of the contract shall be binding on all subsequent holders or assignees of the contract. (FL, KY, MN, MO, MS, NH, NM, WI) Fla. Stat. § 520.08(4); Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. § 190.100(1)(e); Minn. Stat. § 53C.08(1)(d); Mo. Rev. Stat. § 365.130(1); Miss. Code Ann. § 63-19-45; N.H. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:8(IV); N.M. Stat. Ann. § 58-19-14; Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.303; Wis. Stat. § 218.0142(6)(a)
 
c.	When Wells Fargo purchases, receives, or is assigned a retail installment contract, then Wells Fargo must renew the contract in accordance with applicable state laws. (MI) Mich. Comp. Laws § 492.134(b)
 
d.	When Wells Fargo issues a conditional sale contract, it must contain certain notices and meet certain formatting requirements. (CA) Cal Civ. Code § 2982(r); Cal Civ. Code § 2982(h); Cal Civ. Code § 2982.2; Cal Civ. Code § 2984.1 
 
e.	When Wells Fargo is acting as a buyer, and the retail installment contract provides that if a buyer rejects or revokes acceptance of the motor vehicle and asserts a security interest in the motor vehicle based on the ground of rightful rejection or justifiable revocation, Wells Fargo must post a bond of the disputed balance or deposit all accrued installment payments into a court registry. (FL) Fla. Stat. § 520.07(10)(a)-(b)
 
f.	When offering a conditional sale contract, Wells Fargo must not include certain enumerated provisions. (CA) Cal Civ. Code § 2984.2(a)-(c)
 
g.	When issuing a retail installment contract, the statutorily required disclosure statements must be no smaller than 18-point font. (CT) Conn. Agencies Regs. § 42-179-8(a), (b)
 
h.	When Wells Fargo receives prepayment from a buyer of any portion of a retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must refund certain unearned charges, and those unearned charges must be computed in a manner that is at least as favorable to the buyer as the actuarial method. (MA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 255B, § 10
 
i.	When offering a motor vehicle for sale, Wells Fargo must ensure the agreement has been approved by the Board and Attorney General. (NE) Neb. Rev. Stat. § 60-1417
 
j.	When offering a repossessed vehicle for sale, Wells Fargo must:
 
i.	provide enumerated written disclosures in a clear manner. (UT) Utah Code Ann. § 41-3-408(2)
 
ii.	obtain the consumer's signature on the disclosures prior to completing the sale, lease, or transfer. (UT) Utah Code Ann. § 41-3-408(2)(e)
 
iii.	deliver a copy of the signed disclosure to the Motor Vehicle Division within 30 days after the sale, lease, or transfer. (UT) Utah Code Ann. § 41-3-408(2)(f)
 
iv.	affix a disclosure statement in conformance with the statute on the lower corner of the windshield furthest from the driver's side. (UT) Utah Code Ann. § 41-3-408(3)(a)
 
k.	On the Disclosure Form, Wells Fargo must disclose the amount financed as a percentage of the Vehicle Price to determine whether negative equity is being financed in the transaction. (VT) 21-010-017 Vt. Code R. § 5(2)
 
i.	Wells Fargo must deliver the Disclosure Form with every motor vehicle installment contract, even if it involves negative equity. (DE, VT) 5-2900-2901 Del. Admin. Code § 5.0; 21-010-017 Vt. Code R. § 7(1)-(3)
 
ii.	Wells Fargo must attach the Disclosure Form to any subsequent assignment, sale, or transfer of the motor vehicle installment contract. (VT) 21-010-017 Vt. Code R. § 7(1)-(3)
 
iii.	When Wells Fargo is acting as a motor vehicle dealer, it must provide the buyer with an unexecuted copy of the Disclosure Form, and it must be signed by the buyer prior to completing the transaction. (VT) 21-010-017 Vt. Code R. § 7(1)-(3)
 
l.	In an installment contract, Wells Fargo must state "RETAIL INSTALLMENT CONTRACT" in at least 10-point bold font above the signature line, as well as include certain liability disclosure language, and a "Notice to Buyer". (DE, FL, GA, IL, NM, NY, OR) Del. Code Ann. tit. 5, § 2907(b); Fla. Stat. § 520.07(1)(b); Ga. Code Ann. § 10-1-32(b); Ga. Code Ann. § 10-1-32(b) § 10-1-32(d); 815 Ill Comp. Stat. 375/3(c)(3); N.M. Stat. Ann. § 58-19-7(D); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law § 302(2)(a)-(c); Or. Rev. Stat. § 83.520(2); Or. Rev. Stat. § 83.565(d)
  
m.	Wells Fargo, acting as a licensee, must not make any false or misleading advertisements regarding any part of a motor vehicle retail installment sales contract. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code § 84.702(a)
 
i.	When transferring ownership of a motor vehicle, Wells Fargo must disclose the vehicle's mileage in writing to the transferee. Wells Fargo must not knowingly make false statements regarding the mileage or odometer reading or alter in any way any information provided in the mileage disclosure statement. (WI) Wis. Stat. § 342.155(1)(a); Wis. Stat. § 342.155(2); Wis. Stat. § 342.155(3)
 
n.	When Wells Fargo, acting as a licensee, advertises rates, terms, or conditions of a motor vehicle installment transaction, it must comply with federal disclosure requirements. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code § 84.702(d)
 
o.	When entering into a non-model standard retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must include a certification of readability. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code § 84.802(a) and (b)	
 
p.	To be easily readable, Wells Fargo must use Arial, Calibri, Caslon, Century Schoolbook, Garamond, Helvetica, Scala, or Times New Roman typeface in at least 8-point font for its motor vehicle installment contracts. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code § 84.806(b); 7 Tex. Admin. Code § 84.806(d)
 
q.	In addition to the Office of Consumer Credit Commissioner notice requirements, Wells Fargo must make certain disclosures including on what type of earnings method Wells Fargo is applying. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code § 84.805(a)-(b)
 
r.	Wells Fargo must include a specific disclosure notice to the buyer in 10-point font that is either bold, capitalized, or underlined directly above the buyer's signature. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.102(c)
 
s.	Wells Fargo must print the Disclosure Form on an easily distinguishable, separate sheet of paper, in at least 12-point font, and provide a copy to the buyer(s). (VT) 21-010-017 Vt. Code R. § 6
 
t.	When Wells Fargo is entering into a prelease agreement, it must place specific notice language directly above the signature line, in bold-faced capital letters in at least 10-point font, under the heading: NOTICE TO PROSPECTIVE LESSEE. (WI) Wis. Stat. § 218.0144(2)(b)
 
u.	In addition to following the Office of Consumer Credit Commissioner's instructions, Wells Fargo must submit the retail installment contract in a non-locked text-searchable PDF on 8.5 x 11-inch or 8.5 x 14-inch paper. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code § 84.802(c)(2)
 
v.	In a retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must deliver a copy of the contract to the buyer that shall include all the required disclosures and information about the transaction. Wells Fargo must provide an acknowledgement of delivery to be signed by the buyer, which is printed in at least 12-point type that is bold-faced, capitalized, or underlined, and if contained in the contract, shall appear directly above the buyer's signature. (AZ, CA, CT, FL, MI, NH, NM, TX) Ariz Rev. Stat. § 44-286(B); Cal. Civ. Code § 2984.3; Fla. Stat. § 520.07(1)(c) and (e)(7); Mich. Comp. Laws § 492.112(e); N.H. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:7(I)(c), (d); N. H. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:7(VI); N.M Stat. Ann. § 58-19-7(C); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.112(a); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.112(b)

w.	When engaged in a contract of the lease or buyback of a vehicle, Wells Fargo must provide certain written disclosure language in the contract in 12-point boldface type and heading in 16-point boldface type. The language of the "DISCLOSURE STATEMENT" must be boxed and contain a notice warning that the vehicle was previously sold as new and disclosing any defects or conditions subsequently alleged or found. Conn. Agencies Regs. § 42-179-8(c), (d)
 
x.	When Wells Fargo seeks to include a documentary fee in a retail installment contract, it must meet certain enumerated requirements. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.006(c)(3)
 
y.	When Wells Fargo seeks to amend or correct a retail installment contract, it must confirm so in writing signed by the retail buyer, and then deliver or mail a copy of that confirmation to the buyer. (CA, TX) Cal Civ. Code § 2984; Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.116(1), (2)
 
z.	When Wells Fargo agrees to amend a retail installment contract at the buyer's request to extend or defer any or all installments, Wells Fargo must not charge a refinance fee or other fees that exceed certain statutory limitations. (KY, MO, MS) Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. § 190.100(1)(f); Mo. Rev. Stat. § 365.130(2); Mo. Rev. Stat. § 365.130(3); Miss. Code Ann. § 63-19-39
 
aa.	When the final installment becomes due on a retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must give the buyer a 15-day notice before it can charge interest. (IL) 815 Ill. Comp. Stat. 375/11.2
 
bb.	In a retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must disclose that any refinancing may be for any period and payment schedule to which the buyer and Wells Fargo agree. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.123(c) and (b)(5)
 
cc.	In an installment contract, Wells Fargo must provide for payment of the time balance in substantially equal times and amounts, except in certain enumerated circumstances. (PA) 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 6221(d)
 
dd.	When Wells Fargo is acting as a retail seller, it must provide the buyer notice in connection with the retail installment contract stating that the retail buyer is not required to accept or provide a debt cancellation agreement to purchase the motor vehicle under a retail installment contract. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.124(d)
 
ee.	When Wells Fargo is a licensee for a motor vehicle title loan, it must provide each borrower with a pamphlet that is in a form consistent with regulations and plainly explains the borrowers' rights and responsibilities and provides a toll-free number for the Commission for assistance with complaints. (VA) Va. Code Ann. § 6.2-2215(5)
 
ff.	When completing a motor vehicle installment contract, Wells Fargo must ensure that the Cash Price is consistent on all forms. When motor vehicle rebates are disclosed, Wells Fargo must deduct them from the Cash Price. (VT) 21-010-017 Vt. Code R. § 4(3)
 
gg.	When the calculation of the Cash Price includes Optional Items, Wells Fargo must itemize and deduct them from the Cash Price to reach the Vehicle Price. (VT) 21-010-017 Vt. Code R. § 5(1)
 
i.	When the calculation of the Cash Price includes Optional Items, Wells Fargo must itemize them on the retail installment contract in a conspicuous manner. (VT) 21-010-017 Vt. Code R. § 8
 
hh.	Wells Fargo must compute the finances charged and balance on a retail installment aftcontract based on certain enumerated factors and disclosures. (CA, KY, LA, MI, NH) Cal. Civ. Code § 2982(g)(2), (3); Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. § 190.100(1)(a); La. Admin. Code tit. 46:V, § 7711(D); Mich. Comp. Laws § 492.118(1)-(5); NH. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:8(I)-(III) 
 
ii.	When Wells Fargo seeks to include money advanced or debt cancellation agreements in the retail installment contract, it must be included as an itemized charge. (KY, TX) Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. § 190.100(7)(b); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.404(d)	
 
jj.	When Wells Fargo receives a request from a buyer for cash receipts or information on current balances or amounts due, Wells Fargo must provide the buyer with such receipts or information in writing. (GA, TX) Ga. Code Ann. § 10-1-32(i); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.405(a), (b)
 
kk.	When Wells Fargo wants to ensure the buyer will be responsible upon total loss of the vehicle, Wells Fargo must notify the buyer and require the buyer to sign a separate document that conspicuously discloses that responsibility. (NY) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law § 302A(1)
 
i.	When Wells Fargo is statutorily required to offer to waive its contractual right to hold the buyer liable for the gap amount in the event of a total loss of the vehicle, the notice must also fulfill certain enumerated requirements. (NY) N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law § 302A(1)
 
ii.	When Wells Fargo is acting as retail seller of a debt cancellation agreement for total loss or theft of an ordinary vehicle, Wells Fargo must provide the buyer in at least 10 days a copy of the agreement, and the agreement must set forth specific details. (TX) 7 Tex. Admin. Code § 84.308(d)
 
 
ll.	When Wells Fargo offers to sell an automobile club membership to a retail buyer, the contract must contain certain enumerated notices to the buyer. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.412(a)and(b)

mm.	When entering a retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must notify the buyer prior to receiving signature, that the motor vehicle is equipped with electronic tracking technology that may be used by Wells Fargo to verify the operational status of the technology, to service the contract or lease, or to locate the vehicle for repossession. (NV) Nev. Rev. Stat. § 598.9715(1), (3); Nev. Rev. Stat. § 598.9715(2)
 
nn.	When Wells Fargo enters into a balloon contract, it must contain certain enumerated provisions. (NH) NH. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:8-a(III)(a); NH. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:8-a(III)(c) and (d); NH. Rev. Stat. § 361-A:8-a(V)
 
oo.	When the buyer consents in an installment contract, Wells Fargo must be entitled to a transfer fee not to exceed 10% of the remaining unpaid balance of $25, whichever is less. (DC) D.C. Mun. Regs. Tit. 16 § 331(1) and (2) 
 
pp.	Wells Fargo must not permit any loan processing fee on a motor vehicle retail installment contract to exceed $200 and must meet other statutory requirements. (FL) Fla. Admin. Code Ann. R. 69V-50.075
 
2.	Insurance Products
 
a.	When offering a retail installment contract that includes insurance, Wells Fargo must include certain statutory disclosures pertaining to the type of insurance and scope of coverage, and the insurance must comply with applicable Texas state laws. (TX) Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.209(a); Tex. Fin. Code Ann. § 348.209(b)-(d)

b.	When offering a retail installment contract with the option to purchase life insurance, accident and health insurance, or involuntary unemployment insurance, Wells Fargo must include certain disclosure language in 10-point boldface type informing the buyer that: (i) the buyer is not required to purchase credit insurance to obtain credit, and (ii) to receive insurance, the buyer must sign and agree to pay an additional charge. (MA) Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 255B, § 10

c.	When offering a retail installment contract that includes credit life insurance or credit disability insurance, the installment contract must include a disclosure notice containing information regarding the buyer's entitlement to partial refund of any premiums from prepayment of the installment loan. (IL) 815 Ill Comp. Stat. 375/9.02(1) and (2)

d.	When offering a retail installment contract that provides for insurance coverage, Wells Fargo must either: (1) ensure that the policy includes public liability coverage protecting the driver against damages from negligent use of the vehicle; or (2) notify to the buyer in writing at the time of the contract that the motor vehicle is not covered by public liability insurance and obtaining a signed acknowledgment from the buyer indicating that he or she has been so notified. (WI) Wis. Stat. § 218.0143(1)-(2)

e.	When engaging in a retail installment contract that includes insurance coverage for the buyer, Wells Fargo must provide copies of any policies, certificates of insurance, and other coverage information to the buyer within 30 days of the execution of the retail installment contract, as well as comply with other statutory requirements. (CT, IL, KY, NY, MN, MO, PA, VT) Conn. Agencies Regs. § A-288-2; 815 Ill Comp. Stat. 375/9; 815 Ill Comp. Stat. 375/9.03; Ky. Rev. Stat. Ann. § 190.100(4); N.Y. Pers. Prop. Law § 302(6); Minn. Stat. § 53C.08(3); Mo. Rev. Stat. § 365.080(1); 12 Pa. Cons. Stat. § 6241(c)(2), (3), (5) and (7); Vt. Stat. Ann. tit. 9, § 2355(g)
 
f.	When Wells Fargo offers a retail installment contract that includes insurance coverage, Wells Fargo must ensure that the policies or certificates of insurance are written for the full term for which a premium has been charged to the borrower, and Wells Fargo must pay all such premiums to the insurance company for whom the premium was collected. (CT) Conn. Agencies Regs. § A-288-4
 
g.	When the retail installment contract charges for insurance, but Wells Fargo is unable to purchase the insurance or the insurance premium cost changes, Wells Fargo must advise the purchaser in writing by certified or registered mail within 5 calendar days of learning of the inability or increase. (DC) D.C. Mun. Regs. Tit. 16 § 326(1)

result.summary:
Cluster: PSDR - Retail Installment Contracts - Motor Vehicles

MCR 1152

Covered States: 
AK, AZ, CA, CT, DC, DE, FL, GA, IA, IL, KY, LA, MA, MD, MI, MN, MO, MS, NC, NE, NH, NJ, NM, NV, NY, OK, OR, PA, TX, UT, VA, VT, WI	
		
General Requirement Statement: 
When offering a retail installment contract, Wells Fargo must ensure that the contract is signed, written, and fully discloses material terms. In addition, the contract must follow certain formatting and style requirements. Wells Fargo must also provide certain notices, disclosures and itemized information in a separate document, in easily legible and plain language. These notices and disclosures must be delivered to the buyer or lessor within certain designated times. Wells Fargo must also provide a schedule of payments.
